results.title: Crayfish coast
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The isolated crayfishing settlement of Ngawi is at the eastern end of Cook Strait. This film looks at the livelihood of the crayfishermen and their families in the small stark settlement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Cranwell: the Royal Air Force College
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group
results.brief_description: Eighteen thousand new officers are commissioned annually into the R.A.F. Those who come from the Cranwell Royal Air Force College set an especially high standard. Cadets are trained as pilots and navigators and for the specialist branches - Technical, Secretarial, Equipment, and the R.A.F. Regiment. Great emphasis is placed on leaderhship in all branches, and on the high quality instruction. Cadets commissioned from Cromwell have every chance of getting to the top.

results.title: Cradle To The Grave (1994)
results.brief_description: Released in 1994, Cradle To The Grave was the music video for rap group Thug Life’s latest single. It commented on racial politics and incarceration in the America.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: Released in 1994, Cradle To The Grave was the music video for rap group Thug Life’s latest single. It commented on racial politics and incarceration in the America.

results.title: Crack in the curtains [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jinks Dulhunty, Anna Grieve and Megabeggar Productions
results.brief_description: A roomful of girls share differing opinions about the motives of a peeping Tom that regularly spies on them. Their responses to how they will or won’t perform reflects the different natures of their sexuality, which they are learning about during school hours. One night they lay in wait while someone poses as bait in the window; their collective power is frightening and a definite result will be achieved. Cast includes Kaarin Fairfax, Danielle Spencer and Angie Regia.

results.title: Cover to cover looks at ... = a pet for Mrs Arbuckle ...
results.creator_credit: Anna Grieve, John Marsh, Don Fitzsimmons and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Three programs from the Cover to cover series which look at three of Australia’s best known children’s books. The authors and illustrators talk about how their books evolved, the techniques they used and other aspects of their work. The three books discussed are: ‘A pet for Mrs. Arbuckle’ by Gwenda Smyth, illustrated by Anne James, ‘Five times dizzy’ by Nadia Wheatley and ‘The Inside hedge story’ by Gillian Barnett.

results.title: Cousin
results.creator_credit: Adam Elliot and Adam Benjamin Elliot Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The narrator reflects back on his youth spent with a cousin who suffered from cerebral palsy. The memories evoked supply images of superheroes, liquorice smells, the way he broke a finger of someone who picked on him, and the separation that occurs as the two cousins grow older and further apart. Narrated by William McInnes. This clay animation film forms part of the autobiographical trilogy that includes “Uncle”, “Brother” and “Cousin”.

results.title: Courtesy: the inside story
results.brief_description: Dramatises common complaints by food service staff about the guests they serve. Suggests ways of handling difficult situations courteously and with poise. Intended for staff training.

results.title: Courtesy, etiquette and attitude in the workplace
results.brief_description: Poor behaviour and practices of individuals in the workplace can impact on the group as a whole. The aim of this program is to identify inappropriate attitudes, behaviours and work habits and to introduce new measures which will improve the work ethic of an organisation. Critical issues addressed: bad manners; attitude; personal presentation; dealing with others and good manners. A training manual accompanies the program and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Country of Islam
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a glimpse of the culture, economy and religion of Morocco as seen through the eyes of Mustafa, a Moslem boy who leaves his village home and journeys to a city to seek an education.
